text: Gentry Support: Man of the Hour
A Confucian Gentleman - a Junzi - is expected to be an exemplar of virtues and example to their whole community. You should always remember to uphold these values.

Your knowledge of the classics and dignified countenance has won you the respect of your fellow landed gentry, and your wise policies and fair governance has secured the loyalty of the farmers and labourers.
With a mastery of the Four Arts, and a reputation for filial loyalty, you have become renowned throughout your home province as a scholar-official to be treated with respect.
For he himself has said it, and it's surely to his credit, that he is a Bashu Man, he remains a Bashu Man!

Steles have been erected in your name, immortalizing your deeds, and word of your reputation is on the lips of every scholar in the Empire. It is said merely mentioning accomplishments are enough for bandits to exchange their blades for ploughshares.
[[b]]%+n[[/b]] diplomatic relations with all non-Han Empire factions
[[b]]Gentry Support[[/b]] can be increased by assignments. buildings, and winning battles against non Han factions.
[[b]]Gentry Support[[/b]] can be decreased by assignments, losing battles agaisnt non-Han factions.
• Gentry Support boost public order but causes corruption.
• Impacts on diplomatic attitude of other factions
• Gentry Support can only be affected by fighting non-Han factions
Using your authority, you fill the local bureaus with candidates of good family names, rather than necessarily by their reputations.
Bribery is a cancer at the heart of government, and you wield the blade to cut it out.
